title: Can you tell if someone else has logged into your Instagram account? - Quora

response.answer_text: If someone tries to access your account on another device, you may be sent a notification about it, and then would have to go through a verification code process in order to re-access your account. In the case that someone does enter your account without your permission and you weren’t aware of this happening, there are a few things you could look for to see if the account has been compromised. For instance, check the search history to see if there were any unfamiliar recent user searches. You can view the previous posts that you’ve liked from your account by going to your user profile. If the other user engaged with other content while in your account you can try to trace that by looking at your previously liked photos to see if you spot anything unfamiliar. Lastly, you can take a look at the profile itself to see if any information in your bio or profile image has been altered. To be safe, it would be advisable to change your password to prevent another user from accessing your account in the future.

There are a lot of different ways to secure your account - link your phone number and turn on two-factor authentication for additional security, save your instagram recovery codes, pick a strong password and change it every 3–6 months. Instagram will inform you if someone tries to log in using another device with a push in your account. In such situation, you'll choose to allow or avoid the user has an access to your account. However, if you are already logged in, you actually have no way of knowing unless you know what you’re looking for. That’s why you need to monitor suspicious activity like uploads that you didn’t publish, followers you don’t recognize or people you are following that you don’t remember following. If the security question is important for you please read this article: https://jelvix.com/blog/how-to-secure-your-data-from-ransomware-and-other-threats

Instagram itself does not alert you when someone logins to your personal account. But you can check how many users are currently logged in to your account and the timing they logged in. To check activity to your account follow the steps give below Go to settingsClick on SecurityInside Security click on Access DataAfter clicking on Access Data click on Account Activity and here you can see all logins and logged out to your account.If you want an alert message whenever someone try to login your account or how many users are currently logged in, you can connect your Instagram account to your gmail account. When your Instagram account is connected to your gmail account you will get a notification that someone just logged in to your account and you can log out to that user by declining that login notification.

In order to notice whether someone has hacked your Instagram account, you will have to pay some personal attention to any activity on your account. This means paying attention to any odd posts or direct messages sent from your account. Do the following to know more about your account’s login: EMAILS FROM INSTAGRAM ABOUT CHANGES YOU DID NOT MAKEIf someone requests a change to their Instagram account, the site sends an email to the address of record to verify the change. If you see one or more of these emails when you haven’t made any changes to your account, then your account has been hacked. VIEW PAST INSTAGRAM ACCOUNT ACTIVITYUnder settings, select “Account Data.” This will bring up a screen full of optional pieces of information you can look at. CHECK YOUR LOGINSThe login record can be accessed via the Account Activity page. TURN ON TWO-FACTOR AUTHENTICATIONTwo-factor authentication helps to ensure that only you can log into your account, as you’ll receive a text on your smartphone with a confirmation code in order to log-in.

Unfortunately there is no way to check and see the direct user who logged into your Instagram account. However, if Instagram believes that this login may be due to your account being compromised (A random login from India) they will lock your account and send you a email. Then once you have received word about your Instagram account being compromised you will be able to change the password and login once more as usual. If someone logs into your account, you will also be logged off. This is an easy way to find out if someone has logged in due to the fact that you will be kicked off and asked to login once more. A great way to avoid never having your Instagram compromised is to change your password on a consistent basis. Therefore, there is no possibility that your account can be compromised.

No you can't. Instagram doesn't make this available and might not store it. They only way you would know would be if they followed you, liked a photo or commented.  If you are really that concerned about someone checking your account, talk to the person about it, report it the police or a trusted adult, or tell them you are deeply in love with them, whichever seems most appropriate. Or just put down your phone and go for a walk. :)  But seriously, it is not that important whether or not someone checked your Instagram. Have a great day!

Yes and No.To check if your account is logged into any other third party application that might be active on your account: Go on the desktop, go to settings, and click the tab that says “authorized applications”, then click revoke authorization. If you want to know if someone ELSE logged into your account via logged in on another device: If you have reason to suspect your account has been logged into another device, CHANGE YOUR PASSWORD! Other than that, that’s the only way !

No, at present there is no way where you can get notified when you log into instagram account as you can get notification on facebook or Google or any other website that has this facility. The only possible way you can get to know that your account was opened is if there are any changes into your account. By changes I mean updated bio, changed profile pic, uploaded photo or deleted photo. If someone logs into your account and likes or comment on other users photo or video it's very tough to find that.

Yes, there is a feature known as two step authenticion in instagram this will help you to protect your account i.e. anytime anyone tries to log in to your account even if they have your password then also they would be asked to enter an authentication code which will be texted to the mobile no. you have provided…and that's how you will be notified about a stranger trying to log inn your account. Also, there's an option in instagram of Security uunder which you will find an option of Access Data where you can when was the last time you logged in your id and some other informations as well   Hope this helps :)
if that person is from other country , you will understand and you receive a notification of Instagram bot in same country , If people have your username and password, you won’t understand

Yes, if you have registered your e mail with your account, you will get a notification whenever your account is logged into some other device. To prevent your account from such logins, turn on two factor authentication for your instagram account.  On turning on two factor authentication, you will get an login code whenever you will login your account to any device. This will prevent your account from unknown logins.  For simplicity, choose the text message option. It is reliable.  Two factor authentication is on!!
This happens sometimes, I usually just go back and log out of all accounts, then log back in the ones that need to be active on the app.
Thanks for A2A! Relax, they won’t be notified unless you take any action on their profile (like e.g. like a photo, comment, start following etc.). Hope it helps! ;)

When someone login to your Instagram, your main Instagram app shows a message into a pop-up,  Your Instagram account login into another device. And you got 2. Buttons It was MeNot meIf you tap on it was me, your Instagram account running normally wich mean your insta account login to another. And if you tap on not me. Instagram shows you an password changing page. And you have to change your password.
They will not be notified at all unless you like a picture, follow them, or watch their story (in which case your name will show up in the list of users who viewed it).

Well i guess you might see that some of your notifications which you haven't seen show as already viewed, or you received messages which were already read( and in fact you didn't read them) or it that person even followed people from your account or even accepted the follow of others into your account.

If they have a personal account, then they will have no idea. If it is set up as a business account, they can see the amount of profile visits per week that they are getting, but they can’t see exactly who is visiting their page.
So go to settings and scroll down to “Privacy & Security” and there you will find the “Saved login info “ icon there u can switch it off
Nothing. But if the login is done from other places that Instagram thinks suspicious, the account will get logged out and you have to relogin.

If you feel you have been compromised or that someone else might be logging into your account you should change your password and as added protection you should enable 2FA so that you get a text message each time someone tried to login. You will keep your account secure and know for sure that you’re the only one logged in.

response.answer_text: Go to settings, click security, then login activity. You'll see a screen like this.(I've never logged in on any device but my on from this acc, but I have on another and it shows when my friend last accessed my account*permission given*  )

What’s going on is that Instagram is giving you easy access back to that account if you want to log in to it. It is a feature that makes things easy for people and not meant to make you panic. If you want to get rid of that account all you have to do is: Open the Instagram appGo to your profile (tap your profile pic icon at the bottom-right of the screen)Go to settings (tap the gear icon towards the right of the screen)Scroll all the way downTap ‘Clear Search History’ (only if you want to get rid of all your search history—this is optional)Tap ‘Log Out of All Accounts’Done :)

Instagram is very sensitive these days about people logging into Instagram. They will generally send the master email address an email when someone logs in to an account where there is a user already logged in or if the IP address is not recognised as being connected to that account.

Yes for sure. If someone is trying to log in into your account. Instagram will send you an email for notifying you that there is someone trying to log in into your account. Is this you or not? If you get such email then take immediate action - best thing is change password and set a stronger one. Thanks for reading.
Yes it does by sending an email To the email account associated with the account just like the way screenshot attached.
It will ask if you logged in and for you to verify next time you login from your normal login device.
Din’t give anybody you don’t trust your Instagram password, so if you’re worried someone is going to look through your stuff simply don’t let them know your password. you’re worth it!

Login into friends account and see whether you’re online or not. or else see the search tab it shows recent searched terms.. or else the photos and activity if you have doubt just change password
